meanings.definition: Guaranteed to bring profit or success.
meanings.sent1: Investing in that bankable business was a smart move.
meanings.sent2: The new movie star is becoming quite bankable in Hollywood.
meanings.sent3: The magician's bankable trick never fails to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious smile is a bankable asset in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The reliable old car proved to be a bankable purchase over the years.

meanings.definition: Able to be relied on for financial support or backing.
meanings.sent1: Having a bankable sponsor can make or break a project.
meanings.sent2: His reputation as a bankable investor attracted many opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was surprisingly bankable during the fundraising event.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was a bankable source of comfort during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy oak tree provided a bankable shelter from the rain.
